intro: Minuartia godfreyi, commonly known as the Godfrey's sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and delicate, star-shaped white or pale pink flowers. Native to arid and rocky habitats in South Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant is often found in coastal dunes and mountainous regions, where it demonstrates remarkable adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
